news_header: A tragic incident at a Crimean Safari Park resulted in the death of an employee after being attacked by lions.
news_text: An employee at the Taiga Safari Park in Crimea was killed by lions when she went to clean their enclosure. The door to another lion area was left open, leading to the attack. The park's owner stated that there was no chance to save the woman, who was found severely injured. A criminal investigation is underway regarding the negligence that led to the incident. The park, which opened in 2012, houses about 60 lions and is one of the largest lion parks in Europe.
